ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: The course was interesting, and talked about many analytical methods. Because we talked about a lot of material that was new to me in the semester, things were a little all over the place. But it was an enjoyable course.

This course covers important topics in statistical genetics. However, I often felt that the statistics were not adequately explained, and I would have prefered to finish this course with a better fundamental understanding of the statistical methods. This issue had many sides to it: the topics were not always fully explained in lecture; the lecture slides available online are not self explanatory so reviewing them after class is difficult; and there was insufficient support for help with homeworks, which otherwise could have been useful exercises in understanding the material. When I sought help on the homework, I was told more than once that I couldn't have a certain thing explained to me because it would give away the answer. In a graduate level course, I would expect the emphasis to be on learning and understanding the material and not the evaluation. Overall, I could have learned more from this course if the lectures had a different structure and the course put more of a focus on teaching rather than testing students.
I need more basic concepts preparation for the biology terms. Either a brief explanation in class or some relevant reading materials would be helpful.
This course beyonds my expectation. It's very helpful for beginner in genetics.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Hongyu Zhao  Dr. Zhao is an expert in the material.

Instructor: Hongyu Zhao  Professor Zhao explains some topics very well but glazes over others. This was especially difficult at times because the lectures, posted online, don't have adequate information to review on their own. Clearer lecture material and more resources would help.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Dr. Zhao knows the material too well which also means he talks really quickly through some of them. I liked some of the homework assignments that involved doing an analysis on a dataset, but I liked the ones that involves proving equations less.

This course covers important topics in statistical genetics, and students pursuing those topics in their research should take this course. However, as I pointed out above, the teaching and structure of this course could be improved. The work load is relatively light, though this had a trade-off with some topics being only lightly covered and explained.
